thread.title: McVitie's has cut the number of Jaffa Cakes in a packet to just TEN - Leicester Mercury

author: Joshua Barrie
title: McVitie's has cut the number of Jaffa Cakes in a packet to just TEN - Leicester Mercury
text:
McVitie's has cut the number of Jaffa Cakes in a packet to just TEN The cakes have become the latest sweet treat to fall victim to 'shrinkflation' Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
First they came for our KitKats. 
Then it was our Toblerones (RIP the iconic peaks). 
Yep, we're talking about 'shrinkflation' - the scourge of chocolate downsizing that's sweeping the nation. Read More 
It's a tumultuous time for lovers of sweet treats, who have had to endure the shrinking of some of their favourite chocolate bars in recent months. 
And it's bad news if you're a fan of a certain orange-flavoured snack. 
Jaffa Cakes have shrunk in size by a sixth without a fall in price, reports The Mirror . You'll now get fewer Jaffa Cakes in a packet (Image: PA) 
Luckily, it's not the Jaffa Cakes themselves - which are definitely not biscuits - that have scaled down, but the packets. 
Manufacturers McVitie's has cut the number supplied from 12, to 10. 
This means that a standard box now contains 122g of treats, rather than 146.4g. Read More 
McVitie’s has admitted “adjusting” Jaffa Cake boxes, but said it also cut its recommended retail price. However, the cost will – as with approximately 2,500 other confectionery products altered over the past two years – fall to consumers. 
“Pricing is at the sole discretion of retailers," the company said. A standard box now contains 122g (Image: Getty) 
A McVitie’s spokesman added: “We have taken the decision to adjust the pack size of our McVitie’s Jaffa Cakes products. 
“There is no change in the size, shape or weight of individual cakes in the McVitie’s Jaffa Cake range.” 
Jaffa Cakes now come with a recommended price of 99p. They were previously priced at £1.15. Read More 
The changes in size and rise in price of chocolate bars are due to a double-edged sword. 
The government is calling for makers to reduce sizes (and sugar quantity) in a bid to cut down obesity rates. 
And manufacturers say that Brexit has caused ingredients costs to rise. 
Either way - we're not happy about the missing Jaffa cakes from the new packets. Read More
